ruleType.name: stacklok/pr_trusty_check
ruleType.displayName: Ensure pull requests do not add dependencies with a low Trusty score
ruleType.shortFailureMessage: PR adds dependencies with low Trusty scores

action.description: The action to take if a package with a low score is found.

ecosystem_config.description: The configuration for the ecosystems to check. Leave empty to use the default configuration.

activity.description: Minimum level of activity to consider as healthy. Values are 0-10 where 10 represents the most active.

allow_malicious.description: Don't block PRs when malicious packages are found (not recommended)

name.description: The name of the ecosystem to check. Currently only `go`, `npm` and `pypi` are supported.

provenance.description: Minimum provenance score to consider. Values are 0-10 where 10 represents the highest confidence in the computed origin of the package.

score.description: The minimum Trusty score for a dependency to be considered safe.

ruleType.description:
Verifies that pull requests do not add any dependencies with low Trusty scores

For every pull request submitted to a repository, this rule will check if the pull request
adds a new dependency with a low Trusty score. If a dependency with a low
score is added, the PR will be commented on.
ruleType.guidance: Ensure that the pull request does not add any dependencies with low Trusty scores.
